017package org.apache.commons.lang3.concurrent;
018
019import org.apache.commons.lang3.function.FailableSupplier;
020
021/**
022 * Defines the thread-safe initialization of objects.
023 * <p>
024 * The idea behind this interface is to provide access to an object in a thread-safe manner. A {@link ConcurrentInitializer} can be passed to multiple threads
025 * which can all access the object produced by the initializer. Through the {@link #get()} method the object can be queried.
026 * </p>
027 * <p>
028 * Concrete implementations of this interface will use different strategies for the creation of the managed object, e.g. lazy initialization or initialization
029 * in a background thread. This is completely transparent to client code, so it is possible to change the initialization strategy without affecting clients.
030 * </p>
031 * <p>
032 * An implementation of {@link #get()} returns the fully initialized object produced by this {@code
033 * ConcurrentInitializer}. A concrete implementation here returns the results of the initialization process. This method may block until results are available.
034 * Typically, once created the result object is always the same.
035 * </p>
036 * <p>
037 * An implementation throws {@link ConcurrentException} if an error occurred during initialization of the object.
038 * </p>
039 *
040 * @since 3.0
041 * @param <T> the type of the object managed by this initializer class.
042 */
043public interface ConcurrentInitializer<T> extends FailableSupplier<T, ConcurrentException> {
044    // empty
045}
